SafetyInspectionBy: NC Dept. of Agri. And Consumer Svcs - Standrds Div

_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: Fill alarm at 80% with auto. Shutoff at 85%, min. Class 1 Div. 1 electric w/in 5 ft. of all transfer (truck offloading) points w/Class 1 Div. 2 from 5-15 feet, Class 1 Div. 2 w/in 15 ft. of remainder
_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: Hydrocarbon detectors, flow monitoring, temperature, pressure, & liquid level indicators
_prev_prog_3.CH_OtherChanges: Installation of N2 Generator system and process analyzer
_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Sample Pump, Bartec Unit, vessel/pipe integrity, ESDs
_prev_prog_3.Description: Butane [(1 x 89,715) gallons plus lines, liquefied and stored under pressure)], blending system involving direct injection into refined product (gasoline) pipelines with bulk truck offloading.  System operations are anticipated to occur primarily during the "cold" season.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Motiva Enterprises LLC - Greensboro Terminal was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA Code) #58 (2001 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is the facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws/codes.  It is the intent of the Greensboro Terminal to incorporate the most recent procedural guidance (NFPA #58-2008) to the extent feasible.  If an emergency were to occur, it is the facility's policy to notify the Greensboro Fire Department as well as the Guilford County LEPC.  Medical emergencies will require notification of the local Emergency Management Services (Greensboro Ambulance) and Moses Cone Hospital.  This facility trains its employees to respond to small or initial stages of an emergency.

The Motiva Enterprises LLC - Greensboro Terminal is a bulk petroleum storage and distribution facility that includes butane blending operations.  This Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the butane blending system, including the associated piping and one 89,715 gallon butane storage tank.

The facility's worst case scenario is the failure of the system's single 89,715 gallon butane storage tank when filled to the greatest amount allowed (85% fill shut-off with alarm at 80%) resulting in a vapor cloud explosion.  The facility's alternate (potential off-site impact) release scenario is a "BLEVE" accident and associated fireball.

The Motiva Enterprises LLC - Greensboro Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR Part 1910.119), and all applicable state and local laws and regulations.  The butane blending system is designed, constructed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA #58 and the manufacturer's (Mid Continent Energy Company, Inc./Texon LP), instructions and recommendations.

To date, this facility h

as never had an accident involving butane which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place.

In the event of an emergency involving the Motiva Enterprises LLC - Greensboro Terminal's butane blending system, it is the policy of the facility to initially contact the Greensboro Fire Department (Primary Response: Station #7) and request their assistance.  The facility emergency response plans are coordinated with the fire department and the Guilford County Emergency Management.  The Greensboro Fire Department has participated in the initial RMP/PSM training session for this system.

Motiva Enterprises, LLC looks for, and seeks employee input, on process safety improvements.  Additionally, the Greensboro Fire Department is contacted regarding participation in site emergency response drills.  The Greensboro Terminal is currently considering a formal flaring procedure in the event the maintenance or repair activities require complete butane removal.  Additional actions include consolidating separate system inspection checklists for ease of completion.
